intro: Serjania chacoensis, commonly known as the Chaco serjania, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Chaco region of Paraguay and Argentina. It belongs to the family Serjania, which is part of the order Malpighiales. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, with compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in dry, tropical climates and is often found in dry forests and savannas. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
